clinical_study.brief_title: Web-Based Intervention Designed to Educate and Improve Adherence Through Learning to Use Continuous Glucose Monitoring
clinical_study.official_title: Web-Based Intervention Designed to Educate and Improve Adherence Through Learning to Use Continuous Glucose Monitoring

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this pilot study is to produce a high-quality, theory-driven, therapeutic, web-based intervention that provides extended training and peer support to adolescents and young adults with type 1 diabetes who are newly implementing CGM. Overall, this web-based intervention represents an efficient way to bring together professionally-supported CGM educational materials and social support to overcome known barriers and address factors associated with inconsistent CGM use.

primary_outcome.description: Analyzing CGM data to determine if there is a difference in adherence between treatment and control group

secondary_outcome.description: The hemoglobin A1c value is a biologic measure of the glycemia that is the gold standard measure of "control" of diabetes. Collected through a blood sample.
Survey instrument that measures self-reported satisfaction with CGM use
Survey instrument that measures self-reported self-efficacy related to CGM use

arm_group.description: Participants receiving the Web-Based Educational Intervention will be enrolled to the research protocol for six weeks of module-based learning and online discussion sessions and followed for a total of 3-months post CGM implementation to collect study measures.
Participants will receive standard clinical care. Similar study measures will be collected to compare between groups.

intervention.description: Completion of a CGM specific web-based educational intervention that includes a series of online learning modules.
Engagement in peer-led CGM specific discussion boards
Standard of Care - serves as the control group for the treatment arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Ability to read and speak English
2. Diagnosed with type 1 diabetes (T1D) for > 3 months before consent is obtained
3. Aged >15 years and <24 years at time of enrollment
4. Must have access to a smartphone, tablet or laptop/desktop computer with high speed internet access and speaker
5. Must be using/initiating a Dexcom CGM
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Cognitive or learning disability (e.g., inability to read) that would preclude their ability to comply with the study protocol
2. Significant medical comorbidity in the adolescent or young adult that could, in the opinion of the PI, affect subject's capacity to follow study protocol
3. Previous use of a CGM within the last 3 months
4. Unwilling or unlikely to return to clinic for a follow-up HbA1c test
5. Unwillingness to accept randomization
